publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 11:21
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid written in English and Japanese.

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

langmaterial.language: The materials are in Japanese and English.

did.abstract: The collection consists of handbills (chirashi), press kits, theater pamphlets, film newsletters, and catalogs that date from circa 1970 to the present. The collection documents over 600 contemporary Japanese directors and their films, as well as major film festivals and events in Japan. The bulk of the materials were generated in Japan and are in Japanese, however, some English-language publicity materials are included. The collection offers a substantial resource for researchers investigating contemporary Japanese film, as well as individual films and filmmakers.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Donated to the Yale East Asia Library by Fukuyama, Sanjiro; Fujita, Motohiko; Hori, Katsuyuki; Nakamoto, Rie; Tsuchimoto, Motoko; Yano, Kazuyuki; Yano, Shigeyuki; Yasuda, Takeshi.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the East Asia Library, 2011.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of handbills (chirashi), press kits, theater pamphlets, film newsletters, and catalogs that date from circa 1970 to the present. The collection documents over 600 contemporary Japanese directors and their films, as well as major film festivals and events in Japan. The bulk of the materials were generated in Japan and are in Japanese, however, some English-language publicity materials are included. The collection offers a substantial resource for researchers investigating contemporary Japanese film, as well as individual films and filmmakers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Japanese Film Ephemera Collection (MS 1905). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two series: I. Directors and films, circa 1970-2009. II. Other film ephemera, 1975-2010.

controlaccess.subject: Advertising fliers -- Japan
Motion picture actors and actresses -- Japan
Motion picture producers and directors -- Japan
Motion pictures -- Japan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I consists of handbills, pamphlets, and press kits doumenting directors and their films.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is organized by director's name in the order of the Japanese syllabary. For each director's folder, if pamphlets and/or press kits are included, those materials are organized by title of film, also in the order of the Japanese syllabary. The director's name is indicated in both the Japanese vernacular and transliterated forms.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is arranged in three sections: Films with multiple directors; Special film programs and festivals; and Film journals and newsletters. The films with multiple directors section is arranged by title of the film in the order of the Japanese syllabary. In cases where a single item includes multiple titles, those titles are separated by semicolons. Special film programs, festivals, and journals are arranged by the name of the sponsoring organization or theater or title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II consists of handbills, pamphlets, press kits, catalogs, and film newsletter documenting films directed by multiple directors, special film programs, and festivals.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material is arranged by title of film.
